channel.title: New Server List Page
channel.description:
In the unlikely event that you haven't noticed, the server list page has been updated. Beware, however, not to just search for the 'form' element and use the new .ws action of that form. Proper navigation will not take you to that action. You will notice their names are aptly slj and sln. J is for javascript, N is for no javascript.
Simply disable javascript in your perl/http getters or whatnot (if you haven't already done so) and you will have no problem going on your merry way. Just make sure you are consistent...

item.title: New Server List Page
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

psb. There is a verse in the bible that describes what you did to a T.

Proverbs 18:13
He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.

The update which I was speaking about is above and beyond the one the community has talked about since the 451 update. Seriously…

Re-read my post and compare the changes that I am talking about to the changes that you are talking about. You will notice they are not the same.

Read full topic

Course we noticed. You’re coming in some what late to the game mate.

Edit: Well, I noticed, for one.

Edit2: Lol already broke the world.java I released. Figure’s. Anyway I’m too busy with side project’s to much mind.

class Protocol : public Packet { public: Protocol(char *buffer); Protocol(int size); ~Protocol(); }

So much to do.

In the unlikely event that you haven’t noticed, the server list page has been updated. Beware, however, not to just search for the ‘form’ element and use the new .ws action of that form. Proper navigation will not take you to that action. You will notice their names are aptly slj and sln. J is for javascript, N is for no javascript.

Simply disable javascript in your perl/http getters or whatnot (if you haven’t already done so) and you will have no problem going on your merry way. Just make sure you are consistent…
